snippet: David Ferrer will assume the fourth spot in the rankings, one ahead of his countryman Rafael Nadal, who beat him in the French Open final. But Ferrer remains outside the big four of men’s tennis.
abstract: David Ferrer will assume No. 4 ranking in men's tennis, one spot ahead of his countryman Rafael Nadal, who beat him in 2013 French Open men's final; but he remains outside big four of men’s tennis--Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray.
lead_paragraph: David Ferrer will assume the fourth spot in the rankings, one ahead of his countryman Rafael Nadal, who beat him in the French Open final. But Ferrer remains outside the big four of men’s tennis.

headline.seo: French Open — David Ferrer Is No. 4, But Not in Big Four
headline.main: Ranked No. 4, but Outside Big Four
headline.print_headline: Ranked No. 4, but Outside Big Four
